Hi David,

On 9/21/07, David <achepati67@...> wrote:
>  Thanks for your reply, but you are assuming to much, because you
>  have to modify the classpath by hand. For example under eclipse the
>  current folder (.) is not on the classpath, so you have addapt the
>  test to the IDE configuration. I know this can be done very easy
>  using Ant, but I don't want to impose to use such tools for this
>  particular example.

Actually, I don't need to modify the classpath by hand because under
Eclipse the source folders are in the class path. For example, you can
do the following successfully in your tests:

getClass().getResource("/com/acme/stuff/testdata.txt");

...which will give you access to the testdata.txt file you've placed
under your source directory:

${basedir}/src/com/acme/stuff/testdata.txt

Or maybe I misunderstood what you meant?

Lasse
